Dataset

The Dataset classe used by MatchboxNet: MatchboxNetDataset

class matchboxnet.dataset.MatchboxNetDataset(dataset, config: MatchboxNetConfig, audio_column: str = 'audio', label_column: str = 'label', time_shift_ms: int = 5, augment: bool = True, noise_db: tuple[float, float] = (-90, -46), spec_time_masks: int = 2, spec_time_max: int = 25, spec_freq_masks: int = 2, spec_freq_max: int = 15, spec_cutout_masks: int = 5, **kwargs)

Bases: Dataset

PyTorch Dataset that yields MFCC feature tensors and corresponding labels, with optional on-the-fly audio augmentations.

This class uses a base FeatureExtractor to compute MFCCs without augmentations, then applies time shift, white noise, SpecAugment, and SpecCutout if augment=True.

__getitem__(idx: int) → dict

Fetch and process a single example.

Steps: 1. Load raw audio array from audio_column. 2. Use feature_extractor to compute raw MFCCs. 3. If augment=True, apply:

  • Time shift

  • White noise

  • SpecAugment (time/freq masking)

  • SpecCutout (rectangular masks)

  1. Retrieve label and convert to tensor.

Parameters:

idx (int) – Index of the example.

Returns:

{

“input_values”: Tensor of shape (n_mfcc, fixed_length), “labels”: LongTensor with the class label

}

Return type:

dict

__init__(dataset, config: MatchboxNetConfig, audio_column: str = 'audio', label_column: str = 'label', time_shift_ms: int = 5, augment: bool = True, noise_db: tuple[float, float] = (-90, -46), spec_time_masks: int = 2, spec_time_max: int = 25, spec_freq_masks: int = 2, spec_freq_max: int = 15, spec_cutout_masks: int = 5, **kwargs)

Initialize the dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Dataset) – Source dataset providing dicts with audio arrays and labels.

  • config (MatchboxNetConfig) – Extracts raw MFCCs.

  • audio_column (str) – Key for the audio array in each example. Defaults to “audio”.

  • label_column (str) – Key for the label in each example. Defaults to “label”.

  • time_shift_ms (int) – Maximum time shift in milliseconds. Defaults to 5.

  • augment (bool, optional, defaults to True) – Whether to apply augmentations.

  • noise_db (tuple) – dB range for white noise injection. Defaults to (-90, -46).

  • spec_time_masks (int) – Number of time masks for SpecAugment. Defaults to 2.

  • spec_time_max (int) – Maximum width of time masks. Defaults to 25 frames.

  • spec_freq_masks (int) – Number of frequency masks. Defaults to 2.

  • spec_freq_max (int) – Maximum width of frequency masks. Defaults to 15 bins.

  • spec_cutout_masks (int) – Number of rectangular cutout masks. Defaults to 5.

__len__() → int
Returns:

Number of examples in the dataset.

Return type:

int
